intro: Kanahia glaberrima, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of Hawaii. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Kanahia glaberrima plays a role in the local ecosystem and is considered a native species of ecological significance.
